title: Utilization depends on total traffic through the link
text:
Link utilization is defined as:
$$\text{Utilization} = \frac{\text{actual throughput on the link}}{\text{link capacity}}$$

For the shared middle link, each of the four server-to-client flows tries to send at its maximum rate. From previous analysis:

Each flow’s throughput = $$\min(R_S, R/4, R_C) = 50\ \text{Mbps}$$

There are 4 flows, so total throughput on the shared link = $$4 \times 50 = 200\ \text{Mbps}$$

Shared link capacity = $$R = 300\ \text{Mbps}$$
